description: Understand and target your social audience.

blocks.name: getReports
blocks.description: Output is ordered by Demographic and followed by Affinity information. For each data point the following metrics are provided value, count, mean, percentile, multiplicity and average. For Geographic, and Demographic data points an additional statistical_info metric will be present with information regarding statistical relevance.

args.name: reportDate
args.info: represents a Unix timestamp of when the report was generated. Default value will be the latest report generated. Date must be in the future.

blocks.name: getSpecificReportDates
blocks.description: Get report dates available for a specific report.

blocks.name: getReportStatus
blocks.description: Returns a list of custom reports generated by user (report name to upload hash etc).

blocks.name: createTwitterFollowerReport
blocks.description: This report uses the twitter followers as the audience. To create custom or tweet reports other methods must be used. Any report older than two days will be automatically regenerated upon create.

args.name: twitterId
args.info: (required if twitter_handle is not supplied) twitter_id must be sent with all client requests. Multiple handles are separated by commas.

args.name: twitterHandle
args.info: (required if twitter_id is not supplied) twitter_handle must be sent with all client requests. Multiple ids are separated by commas.

args.name: filter
args.info: JSON Object. Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form.

blocks.name: generateCustomReport
blocks.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

blocks.name: insertCustomReport
blocks.description: Inserting twitter ids or handles into a custom report. This is used for custom reports only.

args.name: uploadHash
args.info: Upload hash to be used for inserting handles.

args.name: ids
args.info: List of twitter ids, separated by commas, to be inserted into report. Ids must be enclosed with brackets ie. [177490485] or [177490485,23423434].

blocks.name: createCustomReport
blocks.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

args.name: filter
args.info: JSON Object. Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form.

blocks.name: createTweetReport
blocks.description: This report details the audience of the users who have tweeted content that matches what was provided in the keywords. To create custom or twitter reports other methods must be used.

args.name: startDate
args.info: A unix timestamp. start_date will be set to the previous midnight.

args.name: endDate
args.info: A unix timestamp. start_date will be set to the previous midnight.

args.name: terms
args.info: String or Array of JSON Objects. If you are tracking a single term, then the keyword itself is suffice otherwise, tracking multiple terms must be in JSON form. Which results in filtering tweets containing 'http://google.com' OR '#test' AND 'test2'. (NOTE) Make sure to URL encode the terms value for multiple terms.

args.name: filter
args.info: JSON Object. Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form.

blocks.name: getApplicationStatus
blocks.description: Remaining window and remaining count details, also returns reports that have been generated by this account.
